results.title: From the edge of the city = Apo tin akri tis polis
results.creator_credit: Constantine Giannaris, Anastasios Vasiliou, Dionysis Samiotis, Rosebud Films, Mythos Ltd and Hot Shot
results.brief_description: With the fall of the Soviet Union, Pontians (Greek speaking Russians from former USSR) began to arrive in Greece. “From the edge of the city” examines the lives of these immigrants and their children who live literally at the edge of Athens’s immense urban sprawl. Though proudly Greek in their former country, they find that as immigrants they are considered outsiders by the Greeks. Faced with prejudice, unemployment and the cultural dislocation that comes with being migrants, many of the young Pontians turn increasingly to violence, crime and prostitution to survive. Utilising documentary techniques - hand-held camera, straight-to-camera monologues and interviews - the film examines the life of 17 year old Sasha (Stathis Papadopoulos), the brash fearless leader of a gang who sell drugs and their bodies in Athens’s red-light district behind Ommonia Square. Juxtaposing documentary sequences with dream-like evocations of Sasha’s life in the former USSR, “From the edge of the city” is a kinetic work that paints a bleak portrait of the realities facing immigrants in twenty-first century Europe. In Greek and Russian with English subtitles.

results.title: From the bottom to the top
results.creator_credit: Jim Berkey, Paul Quinlan, Claire Stapleton and Department of Education Queensland
results.brief_description: The first part of this tape encourages confidence in the water through familiarization, body awareness and movement in the water. The second part presents a natural progression from water activities to swimming skills.

results.title: From the ashes: stories from the Gippsland Bushfires 06-07 : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Ten locals from the East Gippsland region in south-eastern Victoria tell their stories of survival during the fierce bushfires that swept the area in the summer of 2006-2007. Weeks of preparation and anticipation helped lessen the devastation but in no way eliminated the horror and heartache of living through a time when not only livelihood is in the hands of mother nature, but lives.
results.title_for_label: From the ashes: stories from the Gippsland Bushfires 06-07 : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: From the ashes of war
results.creator_credit: Michael McKennirey, Nico Crama, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film uses stock shots, photographs, and rare archival film footage to document the liberation of Amsterdam by Canadian troops in May, 1945, and the events preceding it. Some of the worst battles, such as the Battle of the Scheldt and the crossing of the Leopold Canal, are shown. The film is narrated by Alex Colville, internationally known painter, who was an official war artist at the time. The film captures the horror of a people at war and testifies to the strong friendship that developed between Holland and Canada.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael McKennirey, Nico Crama, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: From the ashes
results.creator_credit: Helena Solberg Ladd, Glenn Silber and International Women's Film Project Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary tracing the history of Nicaragua from the presence of U.S. Marines in the early 1900s, through several rebellions to the problems of the present (up to 1981). The film focuses on the present efforts of the people to rebuild their country. Includes interviews.
